N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 8 ยง 3.11 - Appropriations, expenditures and accounts

State Regulations
(a) Applications to the Legislature for
appropriations for the department shall be made only with the approval of the

Regents, and shall first be submitted to the committee on planning and
administration. (b) There shall be
kept in the department records and accounts of all business transactions and of
all receipts and expenditures of money. The custody and expenditure of all
moneys, except as otherwise provided, shall be under the control of the
commissioner. (c) The commissioner
shall submit to the Board when requested a financial statement of the funds
under the jurisdiction of the Regents, showing the balances on the date of the
last preceding report, receipts and disbursements subsequent to said report, and the balances on the date of the statement. (d) All officers and employees of the
department having the care, custody and control of public funds shall file in
the office of the commissioner the undertaking of a fidelity or surety
corporation as provided by law. The reasonable expense of procuring such surety
shall be a charge against an available appropriation. (e) Certification or approval of the accounts
or vouchers of the department, or of any agent or agency thereof, or of any
institution under the control and supervision of the department, for submission
to the Comptroller for audit, shall be made by such person as shall be
designated in writing by the commissioner. (f) The commissioner shall direct the
distribution of department publications and fix the price therefor. Notes
